title: Ritual Casting
excerpt: Certain spells can be cast as rituals, taking 10 additional minutes but not consuming a spell slot. Only some classes can cast rituals.
markdown:
# Ritual Casting

Certain spells have a special tag: ritual. Such a spell can be cast following the normal rules for spellcasting, or the spell can be cast as a ritual.

## Ritual Casting Rules

### Time Investment
- Casting a spell as a ritual takes an **additional 10 minutes** beyond the spell's normal casting time
- For example, *Detect Magic* (1 action) takes 10 minutes and 1 action when cast as a ritual

### No Spell Slot Required
- The ritual version of a spell **doesn't expend a [[spell_slot]]**
- This lets you cast powerful utility spells without using your limited magical resources

### Must Have the Ritual Tag
- Only spells that have the ritual tag in their description can be cast as rituals
- Even if you can cast rituals, you can't ritual cast a spell that doesn't have the tag

## Who Can Cast Rituals

### Classes with Ritual Casting

**Wizards**: Can cast any wizard spell they have in their spellbook as a ritual if it has the ritual tag (doesn't need to be prepared)

**Clerics, Druids**: Can cast any prepared spell as a ritual if it has the ritual tag

**Bards**: Can cast any known spell as a ritual if it has the ritual tag

**Warlocks** (Pact of the Tome): Can cast ritual spells from their Book of Shadows

**Ritual Caster Feat**: Allows any character to cast rituals from a ritual book

## Common Ritual Spells

### Detection and Information
- *Detect Magic*: Sense the presence of magic
- *Identify*: Learn the properties of a magical item
- *Detect Poison and Disease*: Sense harmful substances
- *Comprehend Languages*: Understand any spoken language

### Utility
- *Alarm*: Set a magical alarm
- *Unseen Servant*: Create an invisible servant
- *Find Familiar*: Summon a familiar spirit
- *Leomund's Tiny Hut*: Create a dome of force
- *Water Breathing*: Grant ability to breathe underwater
